greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n)=3-k(n), where k=A000002=Kolakoski sequence; also the sequence of runlengths of a is k.
comment: The anti-Kolakoski sequence: a(n) never equals the length of the n-th run. Start with a(1)=2, then the first run is of length 1 and a(2)=1; thus the 2nd run is of length 2 and a(3)=1, thus a(4)=a(5)=2, etc. - _Jean-Christophe Hervé_, Nov 10 2014
results.author: _Clark Kimberling_
